properties.name: (Optional) - East Shinjuku
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeShinjuku Eastmouth is the high street shopping area. It\'s also where you will find "Kabukicho", the red light district. - tokyoessentials.com

properties.name: 10:00AM - Yebisu Garden Place
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeYebisu is a beer produced by the Sapporo Breweries Limited. It comes in three varieties: Yebisu (Premium), a Dortmunder/export lager; Yebisu Black, a Euro dark lager; and Yebisu Cho-choki-jukusei, a Dortmunder/export lager. -en.wikipedia.org

properties.name: 1:00PM - Meiji Jingu
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeMeiji Jingu is the Shinto shrine dedicated to the divine souls of Emperor Meiji and his consort, Emperor Shoken. Emperor Meiji passed away in 1912 and Empress Shoken in 1914. - www.meijijingu.or.jp

properties.name: 2:30PM - West Shinjuku
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeShinjuku is one of the 23 wards of the metropolis of Tokyo, but commonly refers to just the large entertainment, business and shopping area around Shinjuku Station. - www.japan-guide.com

properties.name: 3:30PM - Ueno
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeUeno Park is Tokyo\'s first public park and was opened in 1873. Ueno park has museums, rental boats, monuments, temples, and Japan\'s first-ever zoo, which is completed in 1882. It is one of the most popular areas for Japanese families to visit. - artisandevelopers.com

properties.name: 4:30PM - Asakusa
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeAsakusa is the part of Tokyo most famous for the Sensoji, a Buddhist temple dedicated to the bodhisattva Kannon. There is also an above-average density of temples in nishi-(west)-Asakusa. - en.wikipedia.org

properties.name: 5:30PM - Akihabara
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeAkihabara, also known as Akihabara Electric Town, is a neighborhood in Tokyo. One of the largest shopping areas on Earth for electronic, computer, anime, and otaku goods, including new and used items. - en.wikipedia.org

properties.name: 7:00PM - Yokohama
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeThe Port of Yokohama was opened in 1859 as Japan\'s first modern international trade port and has now become the No.1 cruise port in Japan. The port, conveniently located within Tokyo Bay and surrounded by a rich assortment of tourist attractions, both modern and cultural, plays a vital role as the gateway port for metropolitan Tokyo as well as Eastern and Northern Japan. - japantravelinfo.com

properties.name: 8:30AM - Daikanyama
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeA major business center with many of the international financial offices. Nighttime though it shows a different side, with its various narrow side streets offering a variety of cuisine and places of libation, as well as a glimpse of traditional Japanese nightlife. - tokyopocketguide.com

properties.name: 9:00PM - Shibuya 109
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeShibuya leads Japan in popularity, constantly creating new culture in the worlds of fashion, food, and music. Fashion trends that start here always draw the attention of young people and they quickly spread throughout Tokyo and then the rest of the country. - www.tcvb.or.jp

properties.name: Daikanyama
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeA major business center with many of the international financial offices. Nighttime though it shows a different side, with its various narrow side streets offering a variety of cuisine and places of libation, as well as a glimpse of traditional Japanese nightlife. - tokyopocketguide.com

properties.name: Dinner - Ginza
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeThe Ginza is the most exclusive and expensive shopping area in Japan. It is also known for having the most expensive real estate on earth. The streets are lined with neon signs, department stores, boutiques, bars and restaurants. - artisandevelopers.com

properties.name: Harajuku Girl
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeHarajuku girl is a term for girls who gather in the Harajuku district of Tokyo in Japan. They are dressed in any of several distinct styles of clothing that originated in the culture of Japan\'s major cities. The "Harajuku style," named after the Harajuku transit station, combines a wide range of diverse influences. -en.wikipedia.org

properties.name: Lunch - Omotesando
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeOmotesando is an avenue, subway station and neighbourhood in Tokyo stretching from Harajuku station to Aoyama-dori where Omotesand≈ç station can be found. Zelkova trees line both sides of the avenue. Around one hundred thousand cars drive down the main street daily which serves as the main approach to Mejii Shrine. -en.wikipedia.org

properties.name: Shibuya 109
properties.description: Posted by YorkleeShibuya leads Japan in popularity, constantly creating new culture in the worlds of fashion, food, and music. Fashion trends that start here always draw the attention of young people and they quickly spread throughout Tokyo and then the rest of the country. - www.tcvb.or.jp
